Ã¢â‚¬Å“Before anything, there was Kerbol.

The sky was blacker than a cave.

Kerbol was not satisfied with this blackness. He swirled around the sky, creating a giant milky-white circle, but it was not enough. He began to make specks of light in the black sky, until it was covered with them.

He was still displeased.

He bestowed life in some of the bright stars so that they moved of their own will. He created a companion, as big as He was, to accompany Him and make Him happy, and they travelled the sky next to one another. But He was still displeased.

He realized his true purpose.

He focused his beams upon a point directly below Him, and over a thousand Kerbal lifetimes, He created a giant plain of stone. He raised mountains and filled oceans. And yet, it still wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t enough.

And then He focused His entire energy upon the plain below him. Wherever a tiny sunbeam hit the earth, a shoot of grass reached towards Him, and soon the plains were covered green. He directed more energy towards the earth, and trees pushed their way out from the grass. The planet was lush and beautiful.

It was still not enough.

He redoubled his efforts and focused every one of his beams at the ground. And wherever his beams now touched, a Kerbal appeared on the grassy earth.

And, at long last, Kerbol was satisfied with his work.
